title: IND vs AUS: Ravindra Jadeja pays tribute to 'on-field mentor' R Ashwin - The Times of India
summary:
IND vs AUS: Ravindra Jadeja pays tribute to 'on-field mentor' R Ashwin

Publication Date: New Delhi

Source: Times of India

Ravindra Jadeja expressed that he will deeply miss Ravichandran Ashwin, whom he considers an on-field mentor, after Ashwin announced his retirement during the Test series against Australia.

  • Ashwin retires as India’s second-highest wicket-taker in Tests with 537 wickets.
  • He and Jadeja took 587 wickets together in 58 Tests, surpassing the Kumble-Harbhajan duo.
  • Jadeja praised Ashwin's mentorship and their communication during matches.
  • They will reunite in IPL 2025 for Chennai Super Kings.
  • Ashwin reflected on his career and significant memories with teammates.
“This will be my last day as an Indian cricketer in all formats at the international level. I do feel there's a bit of punch left in me as a cricketer, but I would like to expose... I've had a lot of fun.” - R Ashwin

Jadeja's sentiments highlight the bond formed between the two over many years, while Ashwin's retirement marks a significant moment in Indian cricket history.
newTitle: Ravindra Jadeja Pays Tribute to R Ashwin Following His Retirement

summary:

The Israeli military reported that a missile fired from Yemen fell in the Tel Aviv-Jaffa region, injuring 14 people. The strike is part of ongoing hostilities involving the Iran-backed Houthi group.

  • The missile fell early on December 21, 2024, in the Tel Aviv-Jaffa area.
  • Fourteen people sustained mild injuries, primarily from shrapnel.
  • The incident is part of escalating tensions, with Houthis launching attacks on Israel in solidarity with Palestinians.
  • Prior to this strike, Israel conducted airstrikes on Houthi-held regions in Yemen.
“The Iranian-backed group Houthis have repeatedly fired drones and missiles towards Israel in what they describe as acts of solidarity with Palestinians in Gaza.”

This incident marks a significant escalation in the ongoing conflict, highlighting the complex geopolitical landscape of the region.

summary:
Delhi Man Stabbed to Death Over Financial Dispute

Date & Source: NDTV, February 2024

Introduction: A 26-year-old man was stabbed to death in Delhi's Narela area over an alleged financial dispute.

  1. The victim, Himanshu, was living with his friend, Sumit Kaushik.
  2. The dispute involved a loan of ₹45,000 that the accused, Ravi, had borrowed from Sumit and failed to return.
  3. Himanshu threatened Ravi's family over the unpaid debt.
  4. Ravi and his accomplices later stabbed Himanshu to death.
Three people have been arrested in the case - Ravi (30), Sahil (24) and Ashish (26). The fourth accused, Akshay Khatri, is reportedly on the run.

Conclusion: The murder is linked to a financial dispute, and the police are investigating the case further.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi is on a two-day visit to Kuwait, marking the first visit by an Indian premier in over four decades, aimed at enhancing India-Kuwait relations.

  • This visit is expected to “open a new chapter” in India-Kuwait relations.
  • PM Modi will meet the Amir of Kuwait, Crown Prince, and Prime Minister.
  • Key discussions will focus on trade, investment, energy, culture, and people-to-people contacts.
  • He will also visit a labour camp and engage with the Indian diaspora at a community event.
  • The visit aims to strengthen ties with the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC).

title: 10 amazing animals that glow in the dark - India.com
summary:
10 Amazing Animals That Glow in the Dark

Publication Date: December 20, 2024 | Source: India.com

This article explores a fascinating range of bioluminescent animals and how they use their glowing abilities for survival.

  • Fireflies: Use flashing lights for communication.
  • Vampire Squid: Emits light to confuse predators and releases bioluminescent mucus.
  • Jellyfish: Many species produce light to startle predators or attract prey.
  • Glowworms: Larvae that emit light to attract prey.
  • Anglerfish: Uses a bioluminescent lure to attract prey.
  • Firefly Squid: Uses bioluminescent light for camouflage.
  • Deep-sea Tomopteris: Marine worms that confuse predators with bioluminescence.
  • Lanternfish: Deep-sea fish that use light for communication and camouflage.
  • Krill: Small crustaceans that can emit light for communication.
  • Fungus Gnat: Larvae that emit light to attract prey.
“Thanks for Reading!”

The phenomenon of bioluminescence showcases the incredible adaptations of various animal species in their natural habitats.
newTitle: 10 Amazing Animals That Glow in the Dark

title: Top 5 cosmic revelations made by NASA Hubble Space Telescope - HT Tech
summary:
Top 5 Cosmic Revelations Made by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope

Publication Date: December 20, 2024 Source: HT TECH

The Hubble Space Telescope continues to revolutionize our understanding of the universe, boasting numerous significant discoveries. Here are five key revelations it has provided us.

  • Hubble has observed locations more than 13.4 billion light-years away.
  • The universe is estimated to be around 13.8 billion years old, as identified by Hubble.
  • It has played a crucial role in discovering black holes at the centers of major galaxies.
  • Hubble helped scientists study the mysterious force of dark matter, which is causing the universe to expand.
  • It captured images of protoplanetary disks in star-forming regions, aiding in our understanding of planet formation.
“Hubble also captured two moons of the planet Pluto named Nix and Hydra.”

These discoveries not only showcase the strengths of the Hubble Space Telescope but also enhance our understanding of the cosmos, creating a lasting impact on astronomical research.
newTitle: Top 5 Cosmic Revelations Made by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope

Ravichandran Ashwin announced his retirement from international cricket following the end of the third Test against Australia at Gabba, Brisbane. His wife, Prithi Narayanan, shared an emotional tribute reflecting on their journey together.

  • Ashwin retired as India’s second-highest wicket-taker in international cricket with 765 wickets.
  • He was part of India's 2011 World Cup and 2013 Champions Trophy-winning teams.

  • Ashwin plans to continue playing club cricket after retirement.

title: Carlsen downplays Gukesh’s World C’ship win with indirect dig, calls classical chess ‘worst way’ to decide ‘best player’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Carlsen Criticizes Classical Chess After Gukesh's Championship Win

Date: Dec 21, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

World Chess Champion D Gukesh has been criticized by Magnus Carlsen, who called the classical chess format the 'worst way' to determine the best player after Gukesh's historic win.

  • D Gukesh became the youngest-ever world chess champion at 18.
  • He defeated defending champion Ding Liren in Singapore.
  • Carlsen stated that classical chess masks deficiencies in a player's game.
  • Carlsen intends to compete against Gukesh in upcoming tournaments.
“It’s hard to say exactly what measures the best player overall... classical chess is probably the worst way because it’s sort of too forgiving.” - Magnus Carlsen

The discussion around chess formats continues as both players prepare for significant upcoming matches.
newTitle: Carlsen Criticizes Classical Chess After Gukesh's Championship Win
